Getting Started
All you need to know about your eligibility for services and how to apply.




Getting Academic Support
Tutoring, note takers, test accommodation, TRiO Student Support Services and more




Getting High Tech
In our assistive technology computer lab, students with disabilities can work independently or with trained consultants.




Getting Employed
Find out about jobs and internships, and our WorkAbility IV program, to prepare you for your career!




Getting Involved
Get active in the SASC Student Advisory Board, find an internship, make friends!

Find answers to common questions about the Student Ability Success Center

 Make a contribution in support ofthe Student Ability Success Center
 
Give to the Mary Shojai Memorial Fund
 
Your gifts, large and small, are critical to the ongoing success of the Student Ability Success Center Program. Gifts are used in day-to-day operations and to provide assistive technology, professional development, disability-awareness and financial assistance to students.  Thank you for your support.
